title: Netanyahu, Aiming to Capture Gaza City, Reverts to a Risky Military Strategy
summary: Time and again, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel has pledged to defeat Hamas by force. His cabinet’s decision to capture Gaza City risks ending in a familiar deadlock.

title: Israel Says It’s Preparing to Take Control of Gaza City. What Does That Mean?
summary: The decision to expand operations in the enclave went against the recommendations of the military.

title: Netanyahu Broadly Criticized at Home and Abroad After New Gaza Plan
summary: International allies and families of hostages condemned Benjamin Netanyahu’s plan to take control of Gaza City, with the British prime minister calling it “wrong.”

title: Israel Approves Gaza City Takeover, and Trump to Deploy Federal Agents in D.C.
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Trump Escalates a Fight Over How to Measure Merit in American Education
summary: President Trump’s most recent executive order wades into a debate over how elite colleges should weigh grades and test scores versus the obstacles students have overcome.

title: Trump Wasn’t the First to Deport These Men, and He Won’t Be the Last
summary: Dozens of Bhutanese men ejected from the United States are now in refugee camps in Nepal, which doesn’t want them but has nowhere to send them.

title: Intel’s CEO Defends Himself After Trump Calls For Resignation
summary: Lip-Bu Tan, Intel’s top executive, said he was committed to the company after Mr. Trump called for him to step down over reported Chinese investments.

title: Trump to Host Leaders of Armenia and Azerbaijan for ‘Peace Signing’
summary: President Trump appeared eager to project confidence that an agreement could be reached in a long-intractable conflict.

title: Can Russia’s Economy Withstand Trump’s Threats to Impose Sanctions?
summary: The Russian economy was slowing even before President Trump’s latest threats. But the Kremlin has enough money to keep fighting in Ukraine.

title: Japan Says Trump to Correct ‘Extremely Regrettable’ Error in Tariff Order
summary: Tensions have been mounting between the United States and Japan as both sides appear to have starkly different interpretations of a trade deal finalized last month.

title: Taiwan Strained by 20% Tariffs, No Trade Deal and Political Uncertainty
summary: Taiwan’s export manufacturers are facing steeper U.S. tariffs than their neighbors got and getting squeezed by an appreciating currency.

title: What Is Mamdani’s Vision for New York City’s $40 Billion School System?
summary: Zohran Mamdani has not released a detailed plan for public education, but his biggest proposal centers on weakening mayoral control and giving power to teachers and parents.

title: Can Cuomo Match Mamdani’s Social Media Savvy? He’s Trying.
summary: Andrew M. Cuomo’s decisive loss to Zohran Mamdani in the New York City mayoral primary has led to a campaign rebranding that includes a fresh social media persona.

title: For More Than a Century, New Yorkers Have Said the Rent Is Too Damn High
summary: New York City’s renters have been shaping local politics since the rent strikes of the early 1900s. A new museum exhibit illustrates some of the early struggles.

title: Trump’s E.P.A. Filing Fewer Lawsuits Against Polluters
summary: In its first six months, the Trump administration has filed 11 civil cases against polluters compared with the Biden administration’s 30.

title: E.P.A. to Stop Updating Popular Database After Lead Scientist Criticized Trump
summary: The database, which helps companies calculate their greenhouse gas emissions, will continue under a consortium that includes Stanford University.

title: A Starfish, a President, and a Deep-Sea Frenzy in Argentina
summary: A livestream of an undersea project has captivated Argentina as President Javier Milei wields a chain saw on the budget for science.

title: Want to See Opera in the Home of Baseball? Get a Room.
summary: In Cooperstown, N.Y., fans of the Glimmerglass Festival, a celebration of music, are finding it hard to compete for hotel space with other fans there to watch a legend — their 12-year-old.

title: Cory Mills Should Be at Least as Famous as George Santos
summary: When you’re MAGA, they let you do it.

title: Trump Is Letting TikTok (and China) Win
summary: Trump’s disregard for federal law is a gift to the world’s most powerful authoritarian government.

title: One Way to Retire With Friends
summary: We go inside The Bird’s Nest, a community in Texas.

title: Colbert on the Tariffs: ‘Set Your Clocks Back to “More Expensive”’
summary: President Trump is hitting Brazilian imports particularly hard, which is “bad news for meat-based Americans,” Stephen Colbert said.

title: Russian Strikes Kill 3 in Ukraine, Which May Be Left Out of Peace Talks
summary: “Here on the ground, we don’t feel any real changes from all these high-level meetings and statements,” a soldier said.

title: Canyon Fire in Ventura County Prompts Evacuation Orders for Thousands
summary: The Canyon fire grew within hours to almost 5,000 acres as it spread into Los Angeles County, officials said.

title: Manhunt Leaves a Montana Town in Limbo a Week After Bar Shooting
summary: Experts on mass shootings said it’s rare for the gunmen who carry out such crimes to elude the authorities for so long.
